In a shimmering desert, where sand dunes danced under the sun, lived a peculiar penguin named Pippin. He had wandered far from his icy home, drawn by tales of golden sands and endless skies. Each day, Pippin waddled through the heat, donning a tiny sombrero and sunglasses, determined to adapt. He befriended a wise old tortoise named Tula, who taught him to dig for cool underground burrows. Together, they shared stories of their contrasting worlds—ice and heat. One night, as stars twinkled above, Pippin realized that home wasn’t just a place; it was the friendships he forged in the desert.
